definition: (idiom) to talk in a roundabout way to cover up the truth/evasive
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Stop stalling and answer my question.
sentences.chinese: 她支吾其詞避免回答一切問題。

sentences.english: She manages to wriggle out of answering all the questions .
sentences.chinese: 她支吾其詞避免回答一切問題。

sentences.english: Fogg's project as madness; the Daily Telegraph alone hesitatingly supported him.
sentences.chinese: 唯獨《每日電訊報》在支吾其詞地支持着福格。

sentences.english: The minister stumbled over the major question.
sentences.chinese: 部長對主要問題支吾其詞。

sentences.english: She managed to wriggle out of answering all the questions.
sentences.chinese: 她支吾其詞制止回答一切題目。

definition: lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
